descriptionProfile: Climber, Filmmaker, National Geographic Explorer, The North Face Athlete, Paraglider, Writer, Chronic Goofball
Climber, Filmmaker, National Geographic Explorer, The North Face Athlete, Paraglider, Writer, Chronic Goofball

posts.description: About a week ago I broke the Boulder paragliding site distance record, and at the end of a gorgeous 4 hour flight found myself 100kilometers away near the border of Wyoming!  It's not a crazy proud record by modern paragliding standards, but I'm still really stoked to have it for the time being, and it's wild to think how much I've learned in the last two years of obsessive paragliding!  If you haven't already, please check out my film The Fledglings Uncut, which documents the early stages of my paragliding adventures with @mattsegal ...the link to the film is in my profile.  Also thanks to everyone who has supported the film so far!  @thenorthface #skycrack. This is a more recent photo I grabbed of my buddy Josh Finkelstein flying the Boulder site where I snagged the record.

Two days ago I had one of my most outrageous paragliding flights yet!  I launched from Glenwood Springs, and flew over 80k, all the way to Vail using just nylon, string, and thermals!  Big thanks to @sendinglife for guiding me through the technical part of the flight before disappearing on his own 100k vision quest!  The views were other worldly, and the experience surreal.  Spring is respected and sometimes feared by paragliding pilots, because this is the time of year when some of the strongest, most rowdy thermals can be found.  At times I was being ripped into the sky at over 1100 feet a minute!  Wow! @thenorthface @fiveten_official #skycrack

That one time @mattsegal and I flew off of this!!!...the highest peak in Mexico!! full Uncut Fledglings Film is now available for download!  As seen At the Banff and @mountainfilm festivals!  Link in profile, or google The Fledglings Uncut!  If you liked The Sufferfest films,this is like Sufferfest with more danger and nylon!!! @thenorthface @pickybars #skycrack

One more from the Valle de los Condores in Chile of @alexhonnold on a wildly steep and classic  7c.  What are my chances of doing it first try I asked my buddy @mattsegal who had just lowered down from the route?? He responded, "not very good!" Alex concurred! I hand-jammed, or knee-barred almost every move, but I didn't fall!  Thanks for the confidence guys!! Haha! ðŸ˜œ

Some of the talented faces of my recent trip to Chile where much hard climbing was dispatched by this motley crew!!...including @alexandermegos making quick work of what is now Chiles hardest sport route. In order left to right starting at the top... 1: Chilean supermodel crusher  @soholangbehn 2: Megos coach and trainer to the stars "Dicky". 3: Brazil's hardest climber @felipe.camargo 4: American treasure @emilyaharrington 5: The wildly handsome Chilean climber @faculangbehn 6: The quirky cow-eyed @alexhonnold  7: The trad-master @mattsegal 8: and last but not least by Tendon strength and lock off  measures...@alexandermegos  who has the sense of humor of a Brit but with an unfortunate German accent ðŸ˜œThanks @thenorthfacechile and @thenorthface for the awesome trip!

Warning!!! If you are in the SLC area this coming weekend @alexhonnold and I are going to be speaking at the Ogden Climbing Festival about how amazing, strong and handsome we are.  Get yourself tickets!  Now please enjoy this photograph from Chile of our campfire under the Milky Way! @thenorthface @blackdiamond
@mau_huerta pulling down in Chile!  @mau_huerta is one of Mexico's strongest climbers, and more importantly, he's a super nice dude! ðŸ‘ŠðŸ’ª @thenorthface @thenorthfacechile

Columns on columns! A little shot I took two days ago at the absolutely wild Valle de los Condores of @alexhonnold on his first ever free solo!  He might get good at this if he sticks with it!  Big thanks to @thenorthfacechile and @thenorthface for bringing me down for a whirlwind week of fun adventure and climbing.  I think Santiago has the most psyched climbers per capita of any place I've ever been!!

Photo by @csylvia508 of me doing my best competition climber impression while I'm here in Santiago Chile for the @thenorthface masters of bouldering competition, which is the largest climbing event in Latin America!  I was here to help commentate and to do a little slideshow, but I figured I might as well try my hand at the qualifiers.  I'm happy to say I didn't get dead last, though I was close ðŸ˜œ. Santiago has the most stoked strong young climbers per capita that I have ever seen!  Now we are headed to a climbing area called Valle de los Condores to do some traditional and sport climbing with an epic crew including, @alexandermegos @kilifish @emilyaharrington @mattsegal @alexhonnold and myself!  Woohooo!

@james_lucas aka, peaches, aka the climber formerly known as the "Last Dirtbag"... crushes 5.12 like it was a grape.  He was living in his Saturn station wagon ..until he got a job at @climbingmagazine and soon after a hot boulderite girlfriend who climbs double digits.  James is one of the world's few red point free-soloists, an honor he earned after decking from 100 feet off of the north overhang in J-tree, and then coming back a year later to successfully solo it.  James went on to free climb el cap in a day after that...but he has so much metal in him, he shits himself when you turn on the microwave!! But seriously, James is an inspiring dude!
